intro: Elatostema fugongense, commonly known as the Fugong silverleaf, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with white or pale green flowers. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including China and Southeast Asia. Elatostema fugongense is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and rocky areas.
